author: timothy eichler
title: Behavioural based governance
description: Our governance systems are super complex and are often underdesigned, most solutions solve problems that were not fully understood

assessments.note: Sorry but this doesn't sound like an actual proposal.

This proposal identifies a real problem, but it itself fall victim to the problem that was identified.

The proposal would see improved ratings by clarifying if the proposal is attempting to solve the problem of poorly identified problems in government at-large or if it is attempting to define the problem of behaviour in government.

The proposal doesn't bring in new community members or increase confidence in the communities decision making process.
Except for the fact that one must know before they teach, this proposal appears to me that of someone attempting to get paid to learn.

It's very difficult for me to understand what exactly is being proposed. If I understand correctly, the proposer will continue working on his ideas of governance and then create some articles/videos to explain these ideas? If that's the case, it seems like a very slow way and I doubt that we will see real impact in the next two funding rounds.
PC shouldn't pay for someone to reify their ideas (alone) or to look into articles / videos.

By being open to feedback and iteration with the community there is hope that this may succeed. This proposal's plan for addressing the problem is lacks detail since the problem isn't clearly defined.
Clearly stated, he is asking for funds as personal motivation to learn more.
There is no real operational plan presented so it's difficult to say how likely it is that the project will be delivered.
This proposal doesn't provide information on how it will bring additional community members into catalyst or improve confidence in the distributed decisions made.
Nothing measurable has been devised pro proposed as benchmarks.

No real operational plan, it seems that the 2000 USD requested will be allocated to the proposer for his effort. The only deliverables that can be expected are articles/videos/discussions with individuals.

solution: Design a system by understanding the problem deeply, iterating on that , and going from there.
